title: On the Cost and Benefits of Training Context with Utterance or Full Conversation Training: A Comparative Study
author: Hyouin Liu (Divergence 2% LLC), Zhikuan Zhang (Divergence 2% LLC)
relevance_why: This study on training paradigms for text-to-speech systems aligns closely with Haohe Liu's interests in speech synthesis, particularly in optimizing model training for better contextual understanding and audio quality.
background: The paper compares two training methodologies—utterance-level with context and full conversation—to improve the naturalness and coherence of synthesized speech in conversational contexts.
contribution: This paper introduces a comparative analysis of utterance-level versus conversation-level training for speech synthesis, achieving higher mean opinion scores and better training efficiency with the former.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior discourse in TTS focuses on either utterance-level synthesis or broader conversation-based models, often struggling with contextual relevance and resource demands.
technical_comparison.novelty: This study systematically evaluates both approaches using the same architecture, revealing that utterance-level training can outperform the broader conversation training in both quality and efficiency.

key_innovation: Utilizes a structured empirical analysis of training paradigms to directly compare performance metrics in TTS models tailored for dialogue.
real_world_impact: The findings could guide future developments in conversational AI by providing clear recommendations for training methodologies, potentially enhancing user experience in natural language interactions.
limitations: The analysis is constrained to a specific model architecture and limited dataset, which may affect generalizability.
